sentence.Network_en: The return may be made on the same steamship.
sentence.Network_cn: 可乘同一艘汽船当天回来.

sentence.Network_en: The steamship veered around for the port.
It was so foggy that the steamship almost ran down a small boat leaving the port.
sentence.Network_cn: 雾很大,汽艇差点把一只正在离港的小船撞沉.

entry.def: A steamship is a ship that has an engine powered by steam.

means.word_mean: 1. a ship powered by one or more steam engines

auth_sentence.content: Turner juxtaposes this great white hulk with this small sprightly-looking steamship.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Turner juxtaposes this great white hulk with this small sprightly-looking steamship.

auth_sentence.content: The Comet was the first successful commercial steamship, working a regular route between Glasgow and Helensburgh.

Sentence.sentence: Steamships captured the North Atlantic passenger business from sail in the 1840s because of its much greater speed.
But steamships didn't lose their sails until the 1880s, because early marine engines had a nasty habit of breaking down

sentences.en: The return may be made on the same steamship.
sentences.cn: 可乘同一艘汽船当天回来。

sentences.en: It was so foggy that the steamship almost ran down a small boat leaving the port.
sentences.cn: 雾很大,汽艇差点把一只正在离港的小船撞沉。

sentences.en: He telephoned the steamship office to find out what time the steamer is due.
sentences.cn: 他打电话到轮船公司办公室询问轮船何时到达。
